intro: Pavonia paneroi, commonly known as the Mexican penta, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in shrub form, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and thrives in well-drained soils. Pavonia paneroi is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
